title: Old and Beautiful Museum
review: The various galleries of the museum is categorized as Archaeology,Armoury,Arts and crafts sections.The museum also has a wide collection of stone sculptures,miniature paintings,inscriptions,coins and weapons.

title: Art and craft
review: Government Museum of Ajmer has wonderful collection of art and craft good place for art lover nice visit

title: Museum
review: Government museum is famous for art and craft items. Wonderful place. Government Museum has nice construct building.

title: Small but nice museum
review: It's quite near the train station, only not in the direction of Dargah Sharif, but roughly parallel to the railway. For it  is designated the former  Fort built and walled by the Mughal Emperor Akbar, including a double storied bastion enclosed by columns. However, some of the most revered artifacts – inscriptions, and books for foreign tourists, like me,  won't say much. But sculptures, and for them is reserved more space – literally and figuratively, cannot fail to impress. A good exposition of arms and armoury (including even artillery). Interesting, as always in India, is the section representing local crafts. It is regrettable that it is not as great as I would like. Presented here are also artifacts from the excavations, including even from Mohenjo Daro.

title: Great...
review: It is just great to visit. It is a Art museum so many historical things related to art and craft are here. It is near to railway station.

title: Peace among the chaos.
review: The museum is housed in Akbar’s palace with a peaceful garden courtyard. There are coins from the 1st century and sculptures from as far back as the 6th century along with children’s toys and weaponry. For foreign visitors the entry fee is 100 rupees and is well worth it. If you’ve been in the busy surrounding streets this is an oasis of calm.

title: Actually Akbar's palace
review: Beautiful very well maintained state of the art museum. Must see. Plenty of signboards and exit signs showing the way so you dont get lost. Absolutely no need for a guide. Rest of Rajasthan I was lost without a guide but not in this beauty of a palace built by Emperor Akbar.

title: You can find very old stuffs in this museum
review: You can see very very old god and goddess statue and stuff. And which is very beautiful.

title: lovely old sculptures inside.
review: worth a 15 minute wander through, some very photogenic pieces. well kept grounds around it. shame it is hidden behind so many shops from main road

title: A Nice Museum
review: More than 100 years old this Government Museum is located inside Akbar's palace. There are various gallaries namely archaeology, armoury, arts and crafts etc. In a galary there is a huge collection of excavated coins, sculpture etc. Over all a nice museum. Nice visit.

title: Small museum but may be visited if you are new to Ajmer-----
review: Actually this is a fort built  by Mughal emperor Akbar,it was used for royal family accommodation when emperor come on a sacred visit of famous Dargah of Khwaja moinuddin chistee of ajmer in times of akbar and also in later age,

title: Nice Museum
review: Ajmer Government Museum also known as ‘Magazine’, is situated inside the historical 16th century Akbar’s fort in Ajmer. This place Is inside Akbar's palace.

title: A nice museum
review: Somehow museums are not such a popular tourist destination for us but tone should visit this one which will tell you about the time when Akbar ruled.

title: Small collection of art
review: whatever the museum has is ok , but very small collection of things are been preserved in it but good and one time watch only.

title: Akbar Palace & Government Museum- One & same
review: It is also known as Akbar Palace and is a very small palace & museum. Entry is not allowed in main palace only museum area is open for public which is small area surrounding palace. The museum was opened by Major Colvin in 1908 for public.

title: Government Museum
review: Visited the Museum on 23/02/2017 at around 5.00 P.M.it closes at 5.30P.M every day, thee is Ticket of Rs 20 per person
